alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 14 at 9:20AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF POTTAWATTAMIE... MONONA...HARRISON...SAUNDERS...BURT...WASHINGTON...DOUGLAS...AND DODGE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 919 AM CST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Ute to Waterloo and moving east at 10 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Ute around 925 AM CST. Standing Bear Lake around 1005 AM CST. Northwestern Omaha around 1015 AM CST. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 71 and 101. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
